thread.title: Viacom18 announces online content service VOOT
thread.title_full: Viacom18 announces online content service VOOT - Livemint

author: Vidhi Choudhary
title: Viacom18 announces online content service VOOT
text:
New Delhi: Viacom18 Digital Ventures, the digital arm of Viacom18, on Monday announced its latest digital intiative VOOT! to tap the rising demand for online content.
VOOT!, will have access to Viacom18 Media Pvt. Ltd’s content library, including shows aired on their flagship entertainment channel Colors. It will also focus on original content in a big way, said the company.
The online service will compete with Hotstar, Star India’s digital offering launched in February, and Sonyliv, Multi Screen Media’s online entertainment destination.
The new service will deliver high-quality content to consumers on a wide variety of connected devices, the company //said in a statement//. “The idea of creating this new brand VOOT comes from our desire to create a new, alternate and differentiated world of entertainment for audiences in the digital space,” said Gaurav Gandhi, chief operating officer, Viacom18 Digital Ventures.
“The digital video market, both in terms of audiences and revenues, is set to explode over the coming years. VOOT will not only target to gain a sizeable share of this market over the years, but also lead the way and set new trends in original content creation in this space,” added Gandhi.
Digital advertising revenue in India is expected to grow to Rs. 4,661 crore from Rs. 3,402 crore this year, accounting for 9.5% of overall advertising revenue, according to GroupM, a media-buying agency which is part of WPP Inc.
